meaning_str.bing:
adj. 有经验的；熟练的；有阅历的；有见识的
v. “experience”的过去式和过去分词
网络. 经验丰富的；富有经验的；老练的

有经验的；熟练的；有阅历的；有见识的
经验丰富的；富有经验的；老练的

熟练的；老练的；有经验的；经验丰富的；经验老到的；有见识的；见多识广的；有阅历的；富有阅历的
经历；遭受；经受；感受；体会；体验；（experience的过去式和过去分词）

1.en: If you are the least experienced person around the negotiating table, it's time to hire a great lawyer to help balance things out.
1.cn: 如果你是谈判桌上的新丁，那么你应该聘请一位出色的律师来协助你。

2.en: I intend to forgive those ancestors who sat in the dark lotus of the guru and experienced dark dreams of disease or other life travesties .
2.cn: 我意愿原谅那些位于古鲁的黑暗莲花中、经历了疾病的黑暗梦想或其他生活悲剧的祖先。

3.en: He may not be your heaviest hitter, but in times of great need, you know you can count on the experienced old man to deliver.
3.cn: 他可能并非你最得力的能手，但一旦有重大需求，你就会考虑让经验老手作为你的交付人。

0.en: So, you've experienced this sort of things before? You get used to it.
0.cn: 我说，你经历过这种事比我有经验。你会习惯的。

1.en: Are they real, the things I experienced? My wife? The loss of my son?
1.cn: 它们是真的吗？这些我所经历的事情，我的妻子，我失去了我的儿子。

2.en: No, I don't, Captain. What you experienced was a shadow. It was an afterimage of a victim on a train.
2.cn: 不，我不觉得，上尉，你所经历的只是幻影是一个遇害者脑中的残像。

3.en: But even for those of us who have experienced this before, it is no less of a shock, it is no less terrifying.
3.cn: 但即便是那些经历过这种事的人，此事仍触目惊心，骇人听闻。

4.en: Some of the most moving moments I've experienced as Commander in Chief have been with our wounded warriors.
4.cn: 作为总司令，我所经历的最令我感动的一些瞬间就是和我们的伤残军人在一起。

5.en: You are horrified and you're trying to sabotage it. I understand that. But what might be worse than that is I'm not sure you've ever experienced anything real your entire life.
5.cn: 你吓坏了，所以你想破坏这种感觉。我理解你，但更糟糕的是我觉得你这辈子都没经历过什么真实的事。

6.en: And most importantly, you've experienced the power of community.
6.cn: 还有最重要的，你们体会到了团结的力量。

7.en: It may surprise you to know that l, too, have experienced fear. No. You?
7.cn: 或许你会感到讶异，我也感受过恐惧。不会吧?你?

8.en: In human memory, no such change has ever been experienced. So we can't know.
8.cn: 人类历史上这种情况尚未出现过，所以后果不得而知.

9.en: There is no question that you are a talented, dedicated, experienced professional.
9.cn: 没人质疑这点，你是个天资卓越、爱岗敬业和经验丰富的专业人才。

10.en: Last year was child's play. This year, you're dealing with all experienced killers.
10.cn: 去年是小孩的游戏，今年，你们的对手全都是经验丰富的杀人能手。

11.en: You haven't experienced Sydney until you've felt Bondi's golden sand between your toes.
11.cn: 如果没有踏上邦迪海滩，感受黄金细沙在您脚趾间流过的情景，就不算到过悉尼了。

12.en: Last night, I experienced something new, an extraordinary meal from a singularly unexpected source.
12.cn: 昨晚我有个全新的体验，一顿奇妙的菜肴来自令人意想不到的出处!

13.en: Lucas, these seniors are older and more experienced than us, and I think that they're trying to help.
13.cn: 卢卡斯，他们高年级学生比我们年纪大，资格老，我觉得他们是想帮我们。

14.en: Yes, it seems the quake we experienced here in Los Angeles did major damage all the way up in San Francisco.
14.cn: 目前看来，我们在洛杉矶发生的地震一路蔓延，对旧金山造成了极大的破坏。

15.en: It is important, but not as much as an experienced leader who can deliver Ohio. Then consider me on board, sir.
15.cn: 确实很重要，但不如一名经验丰富能拿下俄亥俄的领导人重要。那么我同意了，先生。

16.en: It was, with Meredith, that I first experienced love. I called her my River Lily. And from that love, Peter. You.
16.cn: 和梅乐迪丝在一起的时候我第一次尝到了爱情的滋味。我叫她小百合。而那份爱孕育出的，彼得…就是你。

17.en: And the states where the minimum wage has gone up this year have experienced higher job growth than the states that haven't.
17.cn: 这些提高了最低工资标准的各州今年的就业增长更快。

18.en: And I, as an experienced traveler on this road on the West to East road, I've prepared a mixtape for all of you today of ten songs that I love.
18.cn: 我作为从西到东这条路上有经验的旅行者，我准备了一盘录音带给你们，里面有十首我喜欢的歌曲。

19.en: Traveling at 17,500 miles an hour, he experienced an effect known as time dilation, and one day the same effect might make significant time travel to the future commonplace.
19.cn: 当时，他在太空时的行驶速度为每小时17500英里。他体验了一种名为"时间膨胀"的效应。而且，終一天 这种效应将会让穿越时空之时间更持久也变以家常便饭的事。
